recipes.name: Naan
instructions: Add yeast and sugar to warm water and put aside.
When yeast is raised to desired consistency, add plain flour, salt and milk or water and knead into fine dough.
Wrap with a plastic sheet and keep in a warm place for 2 to 3 hours.
Then roll out equal portions of the dough and bake in a pre heated oven at 200C for 8 to 10 minutes.
When you see a change in color, brush some butter on top and bake again for 1 to 2 minutes.
Serve hot.

recipes.name: Roghni Naan
instructions: Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water.
When yeast is raised, mix with plain flour, salt and butter.
Knead with milk or water and put aside for 2 - 3 hours.
Fold over kneaded dough using hands and divide into equal portions.
Roll each portion into a flat naan and make fork marks on it.
Bake in a pre heated oven at 200C for 8 - 10 minutes.
When naan turns into a nice golden brown color, brush with butter and bake for another couple of minutes.
Roghni naan is ready to serve.

recipes.name: Makkai Ki Roti
instructions: Take a bowl and put wheat flour and corn flour in it.
Now add salt and water (as you required) to knead it to make dough.
Now make medium balls from dough.
Roll into chapattis on a rolling board.
Pour some clarified butter or oil on tawa put roti.
Roast both the side of it and serve it.

recipes.name: Missi Paratha
instructions: Mix gram flour and red flour in a bowl.
Knead green chilies, onion, chopped coriander, turmeric, cumin, crushed coriander, tomatoes and salt with required amount of water to knead the dough.
When the dough gets ready add 2 tbsp clarified butter, mix well and keep aside for 10 to 15 minutes.
Make balls of the dough, roll it to form rotis.
Heat pan and fry roti with clarified butter.

recipes.name: Shermal
instructions: Take warm water in a cup and put yeast, sugar and mix.
Leave it for 10 to 15 minutes.
When its start to rise, put it in a mixing bowl with white flour, beaten egg, clarified butter and salt and knead it well.
Now wrap it in a plastic sheet and leave it on a warm place.
Now make balls from it and roll it with a rolling pin, with help of fork make marks in the centre.
Now put it in oven for baking for 15 to 18 minutes at 200C.
Brush sheermal with clarified butter and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Methi Palak Puri
instructions: Add salt and make past spinach and fenugreek mixture.
Now add cumin, red chili powder, all spice powder, flour, and oil.
Knead with warm water into a soft dough.
Make balls and set aside for 10 minutes.
Now roll out small puris and fry in hot oil.

recipes.name: Moong Dal Parathas
instructions: Put 1/2 tsp turmeric powder and chilli powder and 1 tbsp oil in the flour and make a dough.
In a vessel, heat 1 tsp oil, add ginger, green chillies, turmeric powder, coriander and chilli powder.
Add the lentils and put about 1, 1/2 cup of water and salt.
Cover and cook till the lentils are separated and tender and water has dried up.
Add pomegranate seeds in it.
Now make small balls of wheat flour and flatten them.
Put 1 tbsp cooked lentils in it, cover into a ball again.
Then roll like parathas and cook on a griddle, smearing it with oil frequently.

recipes.name: Chappati Filled With Mince & Eggs
instructions: Cook mince with red chili powder, ginger garlic paste, onions, green chilies, salt and water.
Cook till mince is tender and place aside.
Mix flour, wheat flour and salt with water. Leave this dough for 5 minutes.
Make small balls of this dough and roll each ball to almost 6 inches.
Place square Samosa Patti over it and place some mice mixture over it.
Place tomatoes, spring onion, all spice powder and chat masala.
Pour whipped egg half over it and cover with other rolled dough.
Cut square with the help of pastry wheel and shallow fry till its golden brown.

recipes.name: Khameeri Roti
ingredients: Clarified butter (ghee) to grease baking tray
instructions: Dissolved the yeast in 120 ml/half cup warm water.
Sieve the flour with salt onto a platter.
Make a well in the flour and pour 240 ml/1 cup water.
Mix flour and water gradually, then knead into a tough dough.
Cover with a damp cloth and keep aside for 15 minutes.
Slowly sprinkle the dissolved yeast over the dough and keep kneading till the dough is smooth and pliable and not sticky.
Cover with damp cloth and set aside for 30 minutes.
Divide dough into 8 equal balls and dust with dry flour.
Press and flatten each ball into round discs, 8 inches wide.
Wearing an oven glove stick the disc to the side of a hot tandoor and bake for 2 minutes.
Remove with a pair of tongs.
Alternatively, place on a greased baking try and bake for 4-5 minutes in a preheated oven at 350Â°F.

recipes.name: Puran Poli
instructions: Clean and wash the gram dhal well.
Boil till it is tender and the water dries up.
If there is excess water, drain it off.
Add sugar to the cooked gram dhal and cook again.
Add ground cardamoms and whole cloves and cook till a thread like syrup is formed.
Remove from the heat and allow to cool.
Meanwhile sieve the flour and mix in about 2 tsp ghee.
Add a little water at a time and knead to a thick dough.
Knead well, divide into equal portions and roll into balls 2 inches in diameter. Keep on one side.
Next grind the gram mixture to a very thick paste and roll into the same number of balls as the flour balls in the palm of your hands.
The gram balls should be almost double the size of the flour balls.
Flatten out the flour balls and carefully stuff in the gram balls.
Seal carefully and roll our like the ordinary paratha.
Place on a tava and fry on both sides using as little ghee as possible.
